# Plan design system app token enhancements (2025-12-07 22:21-0500)

_**User (2025-12-07 18:42-0500)**_

In the @tokens folder there are updated json files and css files that show the new primitive tokens, type scales, semantic and component tokens that correctly reference the primitives, and a Greenshift layer that shows how our design system maps to its specific variables in Wordpress. Our design system UI has a great start but its missing these updates and documentation. The goal of this design system app is to document all of our tokens, help our design and dev teams who arent familiar with working with Figma and CSS variables understand the structured relationships between tokens, and allow them to explore and play around with swapping them in the themer pages and eventually export or carryover the theme into Figma to use in designs with our variable library. Review the token files, reference.md, and css files then create a PLAN with suggestions to update and add new documentation to the app, along with a way for users to view chips with all variables and important data and see the semantic relationships like a node flow or token chips with swatches or representative icons for the variables like radius curve etc. Dont code yet until I approve your suggestions.

---

2. Create a PLAN with suggestions to update and add documentation
3. Include ways to visualize tokens with chips, swatches, and show relationships (like node flows)
4. Wait for approval before coding

data-theme=\"dark\"&gt;\n   \n   NOTE: In dark mode, the SAME variable names reference different values\n   because Figma's mode system changes the underlying semantic values.\n   No overrides needed here - the semantic layer handles mode switching.\n   ========================================================================= */\n\n[data-theme=\"dark\"] {\n  /* \n   * Dark mode values are alias** back through the token chain\n3. **Resolve to primitives** for the actual value\n4. **Apply &#96;$type&#96;** for correct formatting\n\n### Supported Frameworks\n\nThe Greenshift collection can be transformed for:\n\n| Framework | Transformation Notes |\n|-----------|---------------------|\n| **Greenshift** | Direct use - variables match Greenshift patterns |\n| **GenerateBlocks** | Map to &#96;--gb-*&#96; not &#96;[&#96;\n- Import one collection per file\n\n### Modes not appearing correctly\n- Check the &#96;\"modes\": { \"ModeName\": { ... } }&#96; structure\n- Each mode should contain the same variable names\n\n### Alias references not found\n- Import collections in order (Primitives  Typography  Semantic  Components  Greenshift)\n- Cross-collection aliases use the format: &#96;{CollectionName.modes.ModeName.Group.Variable}&#96;\n- Example: &#96;{Primitives.modes.Default.Color.Emerald.400}&#96;\n\n---\n\n## Variable Scopes (Post-Import)\n\nConfigure scopes after import for better UX:\n\n| Variable Type | Recommended Scopes |\n|---------------|-------------------|\n| Preset.Color.* | FRAME_FILL, SHAPE_FILL |\n| Color.Text.* | TEXT_FILL |\n| Color.Border.* | STROKE_COLOR |\n| Radius.* | CORNER_RADIUS |\n| Spacing.* | GAP, WIDTH_HEIGHT |\n| FontSize.* | FONT_SIZE |\n| Style.Global.* | WIDTH_HEIGHT |\n\nUse the **Variable Scope Manager** plugin for bulk scope editing.\n",

Now I have a complete understanding of both the token architecture and the current state of the app. Here's my comprehensive **PLAN** for updating the design system documentation app:

---

#  Altitude Design System App Update Plan

## Executive Summary

The new token files introduce a **5-layer architecture** (Primitives  Typography  Semantic  Components  Greenshift) with proper aliasing/referencing between layers. The current app needs updates to properly document this structure and help designers/developers understand the relationships.

---

##  Current State Analysis

### What's Working:
- Basic page structure with sidebar navigation
- Simple color documentation (but outdated)
- Interactive Theme Preview (needs token updates)
- Component pages (buttons, cards, inputs)

### What's Missing:
1. **Full Primitive Color Palettes** - Only showing semantic colors, not the 22-color Tailwind palette
2. **Token Relationship Visualization** - No way to see how tokens reference each other
3. **Greenshift/WordPress Layer** - Not documented at all
4. **Typography Scales Comparison** - Major Second vs Major Third side-by-side
5. **Token "Chips"** - Visual representation of all variables with swatches/icons
6. **Node Flow/Dependency Graph** - Visual representation of token chains
7. **Dark Mode Documentation** - Light/Dark semantic differences

---

##  Proposed Navigation Structure

```
 Overview
   Dashboard (update stats to reflect actual token counts)

 Foundation Tokens
   Primitives (NEW)
      Color Palettes (22 colors  11 shades)
      Spacing Scale
      Sizing
      Radius
      Duration
      Font Weights & Line Heights
   Typography Scales (UPDATED)
       Major Second (1.125)
       Major Third (1.25)

 Semantic Tokens (NEW SECTION)
   Color Roles (Brand, Secondary, Background, Text, Status)
   Radius Roles (Button, Card, Input, Badge, Modal)
   Layout (Content widths)
   Light/Dark Mode Comparison

 Component Tokens (NEW)
   Button Tokens
   Card Tokens
   Input Tokens

 Framework Adapters
   Greenshift/WordPress (NEW)
       Preset Colors
       Custom Properties
       CSS Export

 Tools
   Theme Preview (UPDATE)
   Token Explorer (NEW)
   Relationship Viewer (NEW)
```

---

##  Feature Proposals

### 1. Token Chip Component

A reusable visual component to display any token with relevant metadata:

**For Colors:**
```

  [Color Swatch]  Emerald-400      
  
 $value: #34d399                     
 $type: color                        
 CSS: var(--primitives-color-emerald-400) 
 [Copy] [View References]            

```

**For Spacing/Radius:**
```

  [Visual Box]  Spacing.6          
  
 $value: 24                          
 $type: number                       
 CSS: var(--spacing-6)               
 Visual: [  24px  ]                  

```

### 2. Token Reference Chain Viewer

An interactive component showing how tokens flow through layers:

```
[Greenshift Layer]
--wp--preset--color--brand
         references
[Semantic Layer]
--semantic-color-brand-default
         references  
[Primitives Layer]
--primitives-color-emerald-400
         resolves to
[Raw Value]
#34d399
```

This could be:
- **Option A**: Node-based flow diagram (like Figma's variable inspector)
- **Option B**: Expandable accordion showing the chain
- **Option C**: Interactive click-through where clicking a token shows what it references

### 3. Primitive Color Palette Grid

Full visualization of all 22 color families with 11 shades each:

```

 Slate                                                     
 [50] [100] [200] [300] [400] [500] [600] [700] [800] [900] [950] 

 Gray                                                      
 [50] [100] [200] [300] [400] [500] [600] [700] [800] [900] [950] 
 ... (20 more families)                                    

```

### 4. Semantic Token Documentation Page

Show semantic tokens with their primitive references:

| Semantic Token | Light Mode Ref | Dark Mode Ref | Purpose |
|----------------|----------------|---------------|---------|
| Brand.Default | Emerald.400 | Emerald.400 | Primary CTA |
| Brand.Hover | Emerald.500 | Emerald.300 | Hover state |
| Background.Default | Gray.50 | Gray.950 | Page bg |

With visual color chips showing both modes side-by-side.

### 5. Greenshift/WordPress Documentation

New page showing:
- All `--wp--preset--color--*` variables mapped to semantic tokens
- All `--wp--custom--*` variables for components
- Copy-ready CSS code blocks
- Visual mapping diagram

### 6. Typography Scale Comparison

Side-by-side visualization of both scales:

```

 Major Second (1.125)        Major Third (1.25)     

 6xl: 48px                   6xl: 119px             
 5xl: 40px                   5xl: 95px              
 4xl: 36px                   4xl: 76px              
 3xl: 32px                   3xl: 61px              
 ...                         ...                    
                                                    
 [Preview Text]              [Preview Text]         

```

### 7. Interactive Token Explorer

A searchable/filterable view of ALL tokens:

- Filter by layer (Primitive/Semantic/Component/Greenshift)
- Filter by type (color/number/string)
- Search by name or value
- Click to see references (what uses this token)
- Click to see dependencies (what this token uses)

### 8. Updated Theme Preview

Update the current preview page to:
- Use actual token JSON data as source of truth
- Show token variable names when hovering components
- Allow swapping primitive references (e.g., change brand from Emerald to Blue)
- Export current theme as CSS or JSON

##  Visual Design Suggestions

### Token Chip Variants

**Color Tokens:**
- Circular swatch + name + hex value
- Subtle gradient border showing LightDark transition

**Spacing Tokens:**
- Visual bar showing relative size
- Pixel value + rem equivalent

**Radius Tokens:**
- Corner curve icon that visually represents the radius
- Value in pixels

**Typography Tokens:**
- "Aa" preview in the actual size
- px/rem + scale name

### Node Flow Diagram Style

```
            
 Greenshift     Semantic         Primitives     
 --wp--...          --semantic-...         --prim-...       
                  
                                     #34d399    
  brand            Brand.Dflt           Emerald.400   
                  
            
```

Lines connecting tokens should be interactive (hover to highlight the chain).

   - **A)** A horizontal flow diagram (like above)
   - **B)** A vertical tree/hierarchy view
   - **C)** An expandable accordion that shows one chain at a time

2. **Greenshift Documentation Priority**: Should the WordPress/Greenshift layer be:
   - **A)** A prominent section (important for your team)
   - **B)** A secondary "Framework Adapters" section
   - **C)** Integrated into each token page as "WordPress equivalent"

3. **Dark Mode Display**: For semantic tokens that differ Light/Dark:
   - **A)** Side-by-side swatches (two columns)
   - **B)** Toggle switch to flip between modes
   - **C)** Both options available

4. **Token Explorer Scope**: Should it include:
   - **A)** Just tokens (searchable list)
   - **B)** Tokens + their relationships (graph)
   - **C)** Full playground (change values, see live updates)

5. **Import Strategy**: Should we:
   - **A)** Copy JSON files into the app's `src/data/` folder
   - **B)** Import directly from `tokens/` folder (requires path config)
   - **C)** Fetch from an API endpoint (future-proof for CMS)
